meanings.definition: To reduce in speed or pace.
meanings.sent1: The car slows down at the red light.
meanings.sent2: She slows her steps when approaching the slippery floor.
meanings.sent3: The turtle slows down to let the rabbit catch up in the race.
meanings.sent4: Time slows down when you're waiting for something exciting.
meanings.sent5: The music slows down as the dancers move gracefully across the stage.

meanings.definition: To cause to be less active or intense.
meanings.sent1: Eating a heavy meal slows your digestion.
meanings.sent2: The rain slows the progress of the construction work.
meanings.sent3: A good book slows the passage of time on a long journey.
meanings.sent4: Her calming voice slows the racing thoughts in my mind.
meanings.sent5: Adding more ice slows the melting of the popsicle on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To become less rapid or vigorous.
meanings.sent1: His breathing slows after finishing the marathon.
meanings.sent2: The wind slows as the storm moves away.
meanings.sent3: The river slows its flow as it reaches the wide lake.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room slows as the meeting drags on.
meanings.sent5: The growth of plants slows during the winter months.
